content.text: A CSS rule consists of a selector and a declaration block.
The selector points to the HTML element you want to style.

The declaration block contains one or more declarations separated by 
semicolons.
Each declaration includes a CSS property name and a value, separated by a colon.

Multiple CSS declarations are separated with semicolons, and declaration 
blocks are surrounded by curly braces.

p is a selector in CSS (it points to the HTML element you want to style:

). color is a property, and red is the property value text-align is a property, and center is the property value
You will learn much more about CSS selectors and CSS properties in the next chapters!
